definition: to carry on one's shoulder or back/burden/responsibility
Holland/the Netherlands/abbr. for 荷蘭|荷兰[He2 lan2]

sentences.english: One always finds one's burden again.
sentences.chinese: 一个人总会再次发现他的重荷。

sentences.english: Almost the entire burden was thrown onto the crowded sections of middle and southern England.
sentences.chinese: 几乎全部重荷都放在英国南部和中部的拥挤区域。

sentences.english: The American economy is too weak to carry this load.
sentences.chinese: 美国经济实在负担不起如此重荷。

sentences.english: The airport and seaport are important to import and export of portable goods.
sentences.chinese: 机场和海港对付进口和出口重荷商品很重要。

sentences.english: Is your life too much to the real thing in the Netherlands?
sentences.chinese: 生活究竟给过你多少真正的重荷于不平呢？

sentences.english: It's necessary because the servers are at their peak.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为我们现在的服务器行将不堪重荷。

definition: heavy load/heavy burden (also fig. of tax)
worn out in body and soul (idiom)
variant of 累贅|累赘[lei2 zhui4]
wound/skin ulcer/(fig.) the desolation of trauma/desolation in the aftermath of a disaster
